subject: Management
title: The Sucker Effect
description: A 60-second lesson on The Sucker Effect.

hook.text: The hardest worker on the team realized nobody else was trying. She stopped trying too.

buildup.text: The sucker effect: productive people reduce effort when they see others not pulling their weight.

discovery.text: It's a rational response: why work hard if others benefit without contributing?

twist.text: This creates a death spiral. One person slows down. Then another. Then the whole team stalls.

climax.text: Make effort visible. Celebrate hard workers publicly. Address underperformance directly.

punchline.text: If hard work feels unrewarded, even good people stop trying.

quiz.question: What causes the sucker effect in teams?
options: Productive people reduce effort when they see others not contributing
Team members work harder when they see peers slacking
It only affects teams with fewer than five members
